Packing size: 2 Litre bottles Best-before Dates: July 15, 2023 to August 30, 2023 A spokesperson for the CFIA stated, The recall was initiated after the company received several consumer complaints about an off taste and unusual odor in the affected batches. title: French Company Pulls Back Golden Nectar Honey Due to Traces of Chloramphenicol
text:
French Company Pulls Back Golden Nectar Honey Due to Traces of Chloramphenicol

A well-known French honey producer, Miel de France, has issued a voluntary recall of its Golden Nectar Honey due to the presence of the antibiotic Chloramphenicol. The recall affects all 500g jars with the batch number B1234 and an expiration date of June 2023.

Chloramphenicol is a broad-spectrum antibiotic that is not approved for use in food-producing animals in many countries due to potential health risks. Consumption of Chloramphenicol residues can lead to serious adverse effects, including bone marrow toxicity.

The affected product was distributed nationwide in supermarkets and specialty stores. Consumers are advised to return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund. No illnesses have been reported to date in connection with this recall.

For more information, consumers can contact Miel de France at 01-45-67-89-00 or email at contact@mieldefrance.fr. The company is working closely with health authorities to ensure the safety of its products.

The recall is being conducted with the knowledge of the French Food Safety Agency.

title: Non-compliant Spicy Sausage Rolls Recalled by Local Baker
text:
A local bakery in Birmingham has issued a recall for its spicy sausage rolls due to undeclared allergens and non-compliance with food labelling regulations. The products were found to contain mustard, which was not listed on the packaging, posing a health risk to allergic consumers.

The affected products include 200g packs of 'Spicy Sausage Rolls' with a use-by date of September 10, 2023. These items were sold in various local retail stores across the Midlands.

The issue was identified during a routine inspection by the Food Standards Agency (FSA). The bakery has since removed the products from shelves and initiated a recall.

Consumers who have purchased the affected sausage rolls are advised not to consume them and return them to the point of purchase for a full refund. The FSA has also issued a warning to retailers to ensure that all recalled products are removed from sale.

For further information, consumers can contact the bakery’s customer service at (0121) 555-1234.

The FSA continues to monitor the situation and will provide updates as necessary.

title: Supermarket Chain Recalls Mixed Vegetable Stir-Fry Kits Due to Undeclared Ingredients
text:
LONDON, October 14, 2023 – British Grocers Ltd., a major supermarket chain, is recalling its 500g packs of Mixed Vegetable Stir-Fry Kits due to the presence of undeclared cashew nuts. The product, which is labeled as nut-free, was found to contain cashew nuts during a routine quality check, posing a risk to individuals with nut allergies.

The affected product details are as follows: 

Product Name: British Grocers Mixed Vegetable Stir-Fry Kit 
Product Size: 500g 
Batch Code: L345678 
Best Before Date: November 30, 2023 

The product was distributed to British Grocers stores nationwide. Customers who have purchased the affected product are advised not to consume it and return it to the store for a full refund. 

The recall was initiated after a customer reported an allergic reaction. British Grocers has since conducted an internal investigation and identified the source of the contamination. No other products are known to be affected.

British Grocers Customer Service can be reached at 0800 123 4567 for further information. 

The Food Standards Agency (FSA) has been informed and is working with the company to ensure the safety of consumers.

title: Unauthorized ingredients found in ready-to-eat meals
text:
OTTAWA, March 14, 2022 – ReadyMeals Inc., a Toronto-based company, is recalling approximately 300 units of its ready-to-eat meal kits due to the presence of undeclared allergens and unauthorized ingredients, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) announced today.

The affected products include the 'Chicken Fajita Bowl' and 'Beef Stroganoff Kit,' which were produced between February 15, 2022, and March 10, 2022. The following products are subject to recall: [View Labels (PDF only)]

12-oz. sealed plastic containers labeled 'ReadyMeals Chicken Fajita Bowl' with a best-by date of 04/15/22.
16-oz. sealed plastic containers labeled 'ReadyMeals Beef Stroganoff Kit' with a best-by date of 04/20/22.
The products bear the establishment number 'EST. 78945' inside the CFIA mark of inspection. These items were shipped to retail locations in Ontario, Quebec, and British Columbia.

The issue was discovered during a routine inspection by CFIA personnel. The products contain undeclared wheat and soy, known allergens, and unauthorized food coloring agents, which were not listed on the product labels.

There have been no reported illnesses associated with the consumption of these products. However, consumers who have allergies to wheat and soy should avoid consuming the recalled items. Anyone concerned about a reaction should contact a healthcare provider.

CFIA is concerned that some product may be in consumers’ refrigerators or freezers. Consumers who have purchased these products are urged not to consume them. These products should be thrown away or returned to the place of purchase.

CFIA routinely conducts recall effectiveness checks to verify recalling firms notify their customers of the recall and that steps are taken to make certain that the product is no longer available to consumers. When available, the retail distribution list(s) will be posted on the CFIA website at www.inspection.gc.ca/recalls.

Consumers and members of the media with questions about the recall can contact ReadyMeals Inc., Customer Service at (800) 123-4567.

Consumers with food safety questions can contact the CFIA online at www.inspection.gc.ca/contactus or by calling 1-800-442-2342.

The CFIA will continue to monitor the effectiveness of the recall and take further action if necessary.

text:

The products were found to contain undeclared allergens, including soy and wheat, which were not listed on the product labels. The affected products were produced between January 1, 2023, and September 30, 2023. The following items are subject to recall: [Labels (PDF Only)]

	1.2-lb. boxes of “TASTY BITES SHRIMP STIR FRY.”

The products were distributed to retail stores across Ontario, Quebec, and British Columbia. The problem was discovered during a routine inspection by the CFIA, which revealed the labeling discrepancies.

Consumers who have purchased these products are urged not to consume them. These products should be thrown away or returned to the place of purchase for a full refund.

The CFIA is conducting a food safety investigation, which may lead to the recall of other products. The FSA issues Product Withdrawal Information Notices and Product Recall Information Notices to let consumers and local authorities know about problems associated with food. In some cases, a 'Food Alert for Action' is issued. This provides local authorities with details of specific action to be taken on behalf of consumers.
